name: Halekulani
instructions:

2. Strain into a chilled coupe glass and garnish
description: A cross between a classic bourbon sour and a tiki drink
garnish: pineapple wedge, citrus wheel, or pineapple fronds, for garnish

ingredients.name: Bourbon Whiskey
ingredients.description:
A type of American whiskey, primarily made from corn and aged in new charred oak barrels. Bourbon has a sweet and full-bodied flavor profile.

To be labeled as bourbon, a whiskey must meet the following criteria:

1. Grain Mash Composition: Bourbon must be made from a grain mash that is at least 51% corn. The remaining portion of the mash can include other grains such as barley, rye, and wheat.

2. Distillation: Bourbon must be distilled to no more than 160 proof (80% alcohol by volume) and entered into the barrel for aging at no more than 125 proof (62.5% alcohol by volume).

3. Barrel Aging: Bourbon must be aged in new charred oak barrels. There is no minimum aging requirement for bourbon, but to be labeled as "straight bourbon," it must be aged for at least two years.

4. No Additives: Bourbon must not contain any additives except water to adjust the proof.

5. Bottling Strength: Bourbon must be bottled at a minimum of 80 proof (40% alcohol by volume).

6. Geographic Origin: While bourbon can be produced anywhere in the United States, it is strongly associated with Kentucky, and many consider Kentucky bourbon to be a distinctive category.

ingredients.name: Angostura aromatic bitters
ingredients.description:
Angostura bitters is a concentrated bitters (herbal alcoholic preparation) and highly aromatic flavoring agent used in the preparation of cocktails and various culinary applications. It is a dark brown liquid made from a secret blend of herbs and spices, created by the House of Angostura in Trinidad and Tobago. Despite its name, Angostura bitters does not contain angostura bark; instead, it features a proprietary combination of botanical ingredients.

Angostura bitters typically comes in small bottles with a distinctive oversized label and a built-in dasher top, allowing for controlled and precise pouring.

Despite the name, Angostura bitters is non-alcoholic in the sense that it is not consumed in large quantities and is used as a flavoring agent rather than a beverage on its own.

Angostura bitters has become an iconic and essential ingredient in the world of cocktails, appreciated for its ability to elevate and enhance the overall drinking experience.
